short_summary: Replace existing apron and taxiway at Canadian Forces Base
full_summary:
## Tender Opportunity: APRON B REPLACEMENT CFB WING MOOSE JAW, SASKATCHEWAN

## Overview
The Department of National Defence (DND) and Defence Construction Canada intend to award a contract for the replacement of the concrete apron and resurfacing of the asphalt taxiway and apron at CFB Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan. The estimated total value of this initiative is between $6-$7 million. This Advance Procurement Notice outlines the anticipated project scope and security requirements to inform interested contractors of the necessary steps to initiate the sponsorship request process for security clearance.

## Project Scope
The scope of work includes:

* Demolition and reconstruction of the concrete apron
* Resurfacing of the asphalt taxiway and apron
* Civil works and sub-drainage piping
* Lighting and signage
* Asphalt and paint markings
* New landscaping

## Security Requirements
To be eligible for contract award, contractors must hold a valid and active DESIGNATED ORGANIZATION SCREENING (DOS) granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP) of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is sponsoring contractors under its Industrial Security Program (ISP) to facilitate the security clearance application process.

## Sponsorship Process
Interested contractors who do not hold the required security clearance should begin the sponsorship request process by applying to DCC's ISP. A sponsorship request application must include:

* Contract number CN79102
* Level of clearance requested

Once submitted, DCC will review and forward the request to the CSP, PWGSC on behalf of the contractor.

## Important Notes
* This is not a bid solicitation, but an Advance Procurement Notice to inform contractors of the upcoming tender opportunity.
* DCC does not guarantee the success of the sponsorship request or the granting of security clearance.
* Contractors are responsible for the completeness and accuracy of their application and associated documents.

## Contact
For questions regarding the sponsorship process, please contact ISP.Sponsorship@dcc-cdc.gc.ca or (613) 998-8974. Questions about the Advance Procurement Notice can be directed to Robin Stotz, Coordinator, Contract Services, Defence Construction Canada at (306) 681-4651 or robin.stotz@dcc-cdc.gc.ca.
